details.who: All Firefox users who have this plugin installed.
details.why: This plugin was discontinued years ago and only worked up to Firefox version 1.5. Because plugins aren't marked as incompatible, there are still many users who have it installed and have recently been experiencing crashes related to it.

details.who: All Firefox users on Mac OS X who have installed the Adobe Reader XI plugin. Users are recommended to update when a new version of Adobe Reader becomes available, or to downgrade to the latest version of Adobe Reader 10.
details.why: The Adobe Reader XI plugin is causing frequent crashes on Firefox for Mac OS X. The impact and this block are currently limited to versions 11.0.0 and 11.0.01.
details.name: Adobe Reader XI for Mac OS X

details.who: All users who have these versions of the plugin installed in Firefox.

details.name: Java Plugin 6 updates 39 to 41 (click-to-play), Windows

details.who: All Firefox users who have a version of the Flash Player Plugin older than 10.2.159.1.
details.why: Old versions of the Flash Player plugin are targeted by known security vulnerabilities, and cause frequent Firefox crashes. We strongly recommend all users to visit the Flash Player homepage to download and install the latest available version of this plugin. This is not an ordinary block. It's just an upgrade notification that will be shown to all users who have these old versions installed, asking them to download the latest version. If they choose to ignore the notification, the plugin will continue to work normally.
details.name: Flash Player Plugin

details.who: All users of the Viewpoint plugin for Firefox 3 and later.
details.why: This plugin causes a high volume of Firefox crashes.
details.name: Viewpoint

details.who: All users who have these versions of the plugin installed in Firefox 17 and above.
details.why: The Java plugin is causing significant security problems. All users are strongly recommended to keep the plugin disabled unless necessary.
